English.Text: They don't take much convincing to tell you what they know, especially when you seem so sympathetic to the challenges of peasant life; "Passing foreign Queens expect your silence for nothing, and yet it is you who must die in the fields for your masters when the harvest has failed." They grumble in recognition, noting that the Queen thought the town beneath her, and went off to stay in a nearby castle. It is now just a question of exactly which of her landed relatives she came here to visit...
